snippet: The country’s highest court upheld guilty verdicts against the three United States defendants in the 2003 extraordinary rendition kidnapping of Osama Moustafa Hassan Nasr.
abstract: Italy's highest court upholds guilty verdicts against three United States defendants in 2003 extraordinary rendition kidnapping and torture of Osama Moustafa Hassan Nasr, known as Abu Omar; decision ends only prosecution to date against Bush administration’s practice of abducting terror suspects and taking them to other countries.
lead_paragraph: The country’s highest court upheld guilty verdicts against the three United States defendants in the 2003 extraordinary rendition kidnapping of Osama Moustafa Hassan Nasr.

headline.main: Italy: Guilty Verdicts in Rendition Case
headline.print_headline: Italy: Guilty Verdicts in Rendition Case
